Source code for omegaml.store.base

   1"""
   2Native storage for OmegaML using mongodb as the storage layer
   3
   4An OmegaStore instance is a MongoDB database. It has at least the
   5metadata collection which lists all objects stored in it. A metadata
   6document refers to the following types of objects (metadata.kind):
   7
   8* pandas.dfrows - a Pandas DataFrame stored as a collection of rows
   9* sklearn.joblib - a scikit learn estimator/pipline dumped using joblib.dump()
  10* python.data - an arbitrary python dict, tuple, list stored as a document
  11
  12Note that storing Pandas and scikit learn objects requires the availability
  13of the respective packages. If either can not be imported, the OmegaStore
  14degrades to a python.data store only. It will still .list() and get() any
  15object, however reverts to pure python objects. In this case it is up
  16to the client to convert the data into an appropriate format for processing.
  17
  18Pandas and scikit-learn objects can only be stored if these packages are
  19availables. put() raises a TypeError if you pass such objects and these
  20modules cannot be loaded.
  21
  22All data are stored within the same mongodb, in per-object collections
  23as follows:
  24
  25    * .metadata
  26        all metadata. each object is one document,
  27        See **omegaml.documents.Metadata** for details
  28    * .<bucket>.files
  29        this is the GridFS instance used to store
  30        blobs (models, numpy, hdf). The actual file name
  31        will be <prefix>/<name>.<ext>, where ext is
  32        optionally generated by put() / get().
  33    * .<bucket>.<prefix>.<name>.data
  34        every other dataset is stored in a separate
  35        collection (dataframes, dicts, lists, tuples).
  36        Any forward slash in prefix is ignored (e.g. 'data/'
  37        becomes 'data')
  38
  39    DataFrames by default are stored in their own collection, every
  40    row becomes a document. To store dataframes as a binary file,
  41    use `put(...., as_hdf=True).` `.get()` will always return a dataframe.
  42
  43    Python dicts, lists, tuples are stored as a single document with
  44    a `.data` attribute holding the JSON-converted representation. `.get()`
  45    will always return the corresponding python object of .data.
  46
  47    Models are joblib.dump()'ed and ziped prior to transferring into
  48    GridFs. .get() will always unzip and joblib.load() before returning
  49    the model. Note this requires that the process using .get() supports
  50    joblib as well as all python classes referred to. If joblib is not
  51    supported, .get() returns a file-like object.
  52
  53    The .metadata entry specifies the format used to store each
  54    object as well as it's location:
  55
  56    * metadata.kind
  57        the type of object
  58    * metadata.name
  59        the name of the object, as given on put()
  60    * metadata.gridfile
  61        the gridfs object (if any, null otherwise)
  62    * metadata.collection
  63        the name of the collection
  64    * metadata.attributes
  65        arbitrary custom attributes set in
  66        put(attributes=obj). This is used e.g. by
  67        OmegaRuntime's fit() method to record the
  68        data used in the model's training.
  69
  70    **.put()** and **.get()** use helper methods specific to the type in
  71    object's type and metadata.kind, respectively. In the future
  72    a plugin system will enable extension to other types.
  73"""
  74from __future__ import absolute_import
  75
  76import bson
  77import gridfs
  78import logging
  79import os
  80import shutil
  81import tempfile
  82import warnings
  83import weakref
  84from datetime import datetime

  86    connect, _connections, get_db
  87from mongoengine.errors import DoesNotExist
  88from mongoengine.fields import GridFSProxy

  90from omegaml.store.fastinsert import fast_insert, default_chunksize
  91from omegaml.util import unravel_index, restore_index, make_tuple, jsonescape, \
  92    cursor_to_dataframe, convert_dtypes, load_class, extend_instance, ensure_index, PickableCollection, \
  93    mongo_compatible, signature

 100                    settings as omega_settings, urlparse, is_series)
 101

[docs]
 105class OmegaStore(object):
 106    """
 107    The storage backend for models and data
 108    """
 109
 110    def __init__(self, mongo_url=None, bucket=None, prefix=None, kind=None, defaults=None, dbalias=None):
 111        """
 112        :param mongo_url: the mongourl to use for the gridfs
 113        :param bucket: the mongo collection to use for gridfs
 114        :param prefix: the path prefix for files. defaults to blank
 115        :param kind: the kind or list of kinds to limit this store to
 116        """
 117        self.defaults = defaults or omega_settings()
 118        self.mongo_url = mongo_url or self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_URL
 119        self.bucket = bucket or self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_COLLECTION
 120        self._fs_collection = self._ensure_fs_collection()
 121        self._fs = None
 122        self._tmppath = os.path.join(self.defaults.OMEGA_TMP, uuid4().hex)
 123        self.prefix = prefix or ''
 124        self.force_kind = kind
 125        self._Metadata_cls = None
 126        # don't initialize db here to avoid using the default settings
 127        # otherwise Metadata will already have a connection and not use
 128        # the one provided in override_settings
 129        self._db = None
 130        self._dbalias = dbalias
 131        # add backends and mixins
 132        self._apply_mixins()
 133        # register backends
 134        self.register_backends()
 135        # register finalizer for cleanup
 136        weakref.finalize(self, self._cleanup, repr(self), tmppath=str(self._tmppath))
 137
 138    def __repr__(self):
 139        return 'OmegaStore(bucket={}, prefix={})'.format(self.bucket, self.prefix)
 140
 141    def __equal__(self, other):
 142        """test for equality of OmegaStore instances
 143
 144        Args:
 145            other: OmegaStore instance
 146
 147        Returns:
 148            True if other is the same database, same bucket, same prefix
 149        """
 150        return self.mongo_url == other.mongo_url and self.bucket == other.bucket and self.prefix == other.prefix
 151
 152    @property
 153    def tmppath(self):
 154        """
 155        return an instance-specific temporary path
 156        """
 157        os.makedirs(self._tmppath, exist_ok=True)
 158        return self._tmppath
 159
 160    @property
 161    def mongodb(self):
 162        """
 163        Returns a mongo database object
 164        """
 165        if self._db is not None:
 166            return self._db
 167        # parse salient parts of mongourl, e.g.
 168        # mongodb://user:password@host/dbname
 169        self.parsed_url = urlparse.urlparse(self.mongo_url)
 170        self.database_name = self.parsed_url.path[1:]
 171        host = self.parsed_url.netloc
 172        scheme = self.parsed_url.scheme
 173        username, password = None, None
 174        if '@' in host:
 175            creds, host = host.split('@', 1)
 176            if ':' in creds:
 177                username, password = creds.split(':')
 178        # connect via mongoengine
 179        #
 180        # note this uses a MongoClient in the background, with pooled
 181        # connections. there are multiprocessing issues with pymongo:
 182        # http://api.mongodb.org/python/3.2/faq.html#using-pymongo-with-multiprocessing
 183        # connect=False is due to https://jira.mongodb.org/browse/PYTHON-961
 184        # this defers connecting until the first access
 185        # serverSelectionTimeoutMS=2500 is to fail fast, the default is 30000
 186        #
 187        # use an instance specific alias, note that access to Metadata and
 188        # QueryCache must pass the very same alias
 189        self._dbalias = alias = self._dbalias or 'omega-{}'.format(uuid4().hex)
 190        # always disconnect before registering a new connection because
 191        # mongoengine.connect() forgets all connection settings upon disconnect
 192        if alias not in _connections:
 193            disconnect(alias)
 194            connection = connect(alias=alias, db=self.database_name,
 195                                 host=f'{scheme}://{host}',
 196                                 username=username,
 197                                 password=password,
 198                                 connect=False,
 199                                 authentication_source='admin',
 200                                 **sanitize_mongo_kwargs(self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_SSL_KWARGS),
 201                                 )
 202            # since PyMongo 4, connect() no longer waits for connection
 203            waitForConnection(connection)
 204        self._db = get_db(alias)
 205        return self._db
 206
 207    @property
 208    def _Metadata(self):
 209        if self._Metadata_cls is None:
 210            # hack to localize metadata
 211            db = self.mongodb
 212            self._Metadata_cls = make_Metadata(db_alias=self._dbalias,
 213                                               collection=self._fs_collection)
 214        return self._Metadata_cls
 215
 216    @property
 217    def fs(self):
 218        """
 219        Retrieve a gridfs instance using url and collection provided
 220
 221        :return: a gridfs instance
 222        """
 223        if self._fs is not None:
 224            return self._fs
 225        self._fs = gridfs.GridFS(self.mongodb, collection=self._fs_collection)
 226        self._ensure_fs_index(self._fs)
 227        return self._fs
 228


[docs]
 229    def metadata(self, name=None, bucket=None, prefix=None, version=-1, **kwargs):
 230        """
 231        Returns a metadata document for the given entry name
 232        """
 233        # FIXME: version attribute does not do anything
 234        # FIXME: metadata should be stored in a bucket-specific collection
 235        # to enable access control, see https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/method/db.create
 236        #
 237        # Role/#db.createRole
 238        db = self.mongodb
 239        fs = self.fs
 240        prefix = prefix or self.prefix
 241        bucket = bucket or self.bucket
 242        # Meta is to silence lint on import error
 243        Meta = self._Metadata
 244        return Meta.objects(name=str(name), prefix=prefix, bucket=bucket).no_cache().first()


 245


[docs]
 246    def make_metadata(self, name, kind, bucket=None, prefix=None, **kwargs):
 247        """
 248        create or update a metadata object
 249
 250        this retrieves a Metadata object if it exists given the kwargs. Only
 251        the name, prefix and bucket arguments are considered
 252
 253        for existing Metadata objects, the attributes kw is treated as follows:
 254
 255        * attributes=None, the existing attributes are left as is
 256        * attributes={}, the attributes value on an existing metadata object
 257          is reset to the empty dict
 258        * attributes={ some : value }, the existing attributes are updated
 259
 260        For new metadata objects, attributes defaults to {} if not specified,
 261        else is set as provided.
 262
 263        :param name: the object name
 264        :param bucket: the bucket, optional, defaults to self.bucket
 265        :param prefix: the prefix, optional, defaults to self.prefix
 266
 267        """
 268        # TODO kept _make_metadata for backwards compatibility.
 269        return self._make_metadata(name, bucket=bucket, prefix=prefix,
 270                                   kind=kind, **kwargs)


 271
 272    def _make_metadata(self, name=None, bucket=None, prefix=None, **kwargs):
 273        """
 274        create or update a metadata object
 275
 276        this retrieves a Metadata object if it exists given the kwargs. Only
 277        the name, prefix and bucket arguments are considered
 278
 279        for existing Metadata objects, the attributes kw is treated as follows:
 280
 281        * attributes=None, the existing attributes are left as is
 282        * attributes={}, the attributes value on an existing metadata object
 283        is reset to the empty dict
 284        * attributes={ some : value }, the existing attributes are updated
 285
 286        For new metadata objects, attributes defaults to {} if not specified,
 287        else is set as provided.
 288
 289        :param name: the object name
 290        :param bucket: the bucket, optional, defaults to self.bucket
 291        :param prefix: the prefix, optional, defaults to self.prefix
 292        """
 293        bucket = bucket or self.bucket
 294        prefix = prefix or self.prefix
 295        meta = self.metadata(name=name,
 296                             prefix=prefix,
 297                             bucket=bucket)
 298        if meta:
 299            dict_fields = 'attributes', 'kind_meta'
 300            for k, v in kwargs.items():
 301                if k in dict_fields and v is not None and len(v) > 0:
 302                    previous = getattr(meta, k, {})
 303                    previous.update(v)
 304                    setattr(meta, k, previous)
 305                elif k in dict_fields and v is not None and len(v) == 0:
 306                    setattr(meta, k, {})
 307                elif k in dict_fields and v is None:
 308                    # ignore non specified attributes
 309                    continue
 310                else:
 311                    # by default set whatever attribute is provided
 312                    setattr(meta, k, v)
 313        else:
 314            meta = self._Metadata(name=name, bucket=bucket, prefix=prefix,
 315                                  **kwargs)
 316        return meta
 317
 318    def _drop_metadata(self, name=None, **kwargs):
 319        # internal method to delete meta data of an object
 320        meta = self.metadata(name, **kwargs)
 321        if meta is not None:
 322            meta.delete()
 323


[docs]
 324    def collection(self, name=None, bucket=None, prefix=None):
 325        """
 326        Returns a mongo db collection as a datastore
 327
 328        If there is an existing object of name, will return the .collection
 329        of the object. Otherwise returns the collection according to naming
 330        convention {bucket}.{prefix}.{name}.datastore
 331
 332        :param name: the collection to use. if none defaults to the
 333            collection name given on instantiation. the actual collection name
 334            used is always prefix + name + '.data'
 335        """
 336        # see if we have a known object and a collection for that, if not define it
 337        meta = self.metadata(name, bucket=bucket, prefix=prefix)
 338        collection = meta.collection if meta else None
 339        if not collection:
 340            collection = self.object_store_key(name, '.datastore')
 341            collection = collection.replace('..', '.')
 342        # return the collection
 343        try:
 344            datastore = getattr(self.mongodb, collection)
 345        except Exception as e:
 346            raise e
 347        return PickableCollection(datastore)


 348
 349    def _apply_mixins(self):
 350        """
 351        apply mixins in defaults.OMEGA_STORE_MIXINS
 352        """
 353        for mixin in self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_MIXINS:
 354            conditional = self._mixins_conditional
 355            extend_instance(self, mixin,
 356                            conditional=conditional)
 357
 358    def _mixins_conditional(self, cls, obj):
 359        return cls.supports(obj) if hasattr(cls, 'supports') else True
 360


[docs]
 361    def register_backends(self):
 362        """
 363        register backends in defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS
 364        """
 365        for kind, backend in self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS.items():
 366            self.register_backend(kind, backend)


 367


[docs]
 368    def register_backend(self, kind, backend):
 369        """
 370        register a backend class
 371
 372        :param kind: (str) the backend kind
 373        :param backend: (class) the backend class
 374        """
 375        self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS[kind] = load_class(backend)
 376        if kind not in MDREGISTRY.KINDS:
 377            MDREGISTRY.KINDS.append(kind)
 378        return self


 379


[docs]
 380    def register_mixin(self, mixincls):
 381        """
 382        register a mixin class
 383
 384        :param mixincls: (class) the mixin class
 385        """
 386        extend_instance(self, mixincls)
 387        return self


 388


[docs]
 389    def put(self, obj, name, attributes=None, kind=None, replace=False, model_store=None,
 390            data_store=None, **kwargs):
 391        """
 392        Stores an object, store estimators, pipelines, numpy arrays or
 393        pandas dataframes
 394        """
 395        if replace:
 396            self.drop(name, force=True)
 397        backend = self.get_backend_byobj(obj, name, attributes=attributes, kind=kind,
 398                                         model_store=model_store, data_store=data_store,
 399                                         **kwargs)
 400        if backend:
 401            return backend.put(obj, name, attributes=attributes, **kwargs)
 402        # TODO move all of the specifics to backend implementations
 403        if is_estimator(obj):
 404            backend = self.get_backend_bykind(MDREGISTRY.SKLEARN_JOBLIB)
 405            return backend.put(obj, name, attributes=attributes, **kwargs)
 406        elif is_spark_mllib(obj):
 407            backend = self.get_backend_bykind(MDREGISTRY.SKLEARN_JOBLIB)
 408            return backend.put(obj, name, attributes=attributes, **kwargs)
 409        elif is_dataframe(obj) or is_series(obj):
 410            groupby = kwargs.get('groupby')
 411            if obj.empty:
 412                from warnings import warn
 413                warn(
 414                    'Provided dataframe is empty, ignoring it, doing nothing here!')
 415                return None
 416            if kwargs.pop('as_hdf', False):
 417                return self.put_dataframe_as_hdf(
 418                    obj, name, attributes, **kwargs)
 419            elif groupby:
 420                return self.put_dataframe_as_dfgroup(
 421                    obj, name, groupby, attributes)
 422            append = kwargs.pop('append', None)
 423            timestamp = kwargs.pop('timestamp', None)
 424            index = kwargs.pop('index', None)
 425            chunksize = kwargs.pop('chunksize', default_chunksize)
 426            return self.put_dataframe_as_documents(
 427                obj, name, append=append, attributes=attributes, index=index,
 428                timestamp=timestamp, chunksize=chunksize, **kwargs)
 429        elif is_ndarray(obj):
 430            if kwargs.pop('as_pydata', False):
 431                return self.put_pyobj_as_document(obj.tolist(), name,
 432                                                  attributes=attributes, **kwargs)
 433            return self.put_ndarray_as_hdf(obj, name, attributes=attributes,
 434                                           **kwargs)
 435        elif isinstance(obj, (dict, list, tuple)):
 436            kwargs.pop('as_pydata', None)
 437            if kwargs.pop('as_hdf', False):
 438                return self.put_pyobj_as_hdf(obj, name,
 439                                             attributes=attributes, **kwargs)
 440            return self.put_pyobj_as_document(obj, name,
 441                                              attributes=attributes,
 442                                              **kwargs)
 443        else:
 444            raise TypeError('type %s not supported' % type(obj))


 445


[docs]
 446    def put_dataframe_as_documents(self, obj, name, append=None,
 447                                   attributes=None, index=None,
 448                                   timestamp=None, chunksize=None,
 449                                   ensure_compat=True, _fast_insert=fast_insert,
 450                                   **kwargs):
 451        """
 452        store a dataframe as a row-wise collection of documents
 453
 454        :param obj: the dataframe to store
 455        :param name: the name of the item in the store
 456        :param append: if False collection will be dropped before inserting,
 457           if True existing documents will persist. Defaults to True. If not
 458           specified and rows have been previously inserted, will issue a
 459           warning.
 460        :param index: list of columns, using +, -, @ as a column prefix to
 461           specify ASCENDING, DESCENDING, GEOSPHERE respectively. For @ the
 462           column has to represent a valid GeoJSON object.
 463        :param timestamp: if True or a field name adds a timestamp. If the
 464           value is a boolean or datetime, uses _created as the field name.
 465           The timestamp is always datetime.datetime.utcnow(). May be overriden
 466           by specifying the tuple (col, datetime).
 467        :param ensure_compat: if True attempt to convert obj to mongodb compatibility,
 468           set to False only if you are sure to have only compatible values in dataframe.
 469           defaults to True. False may reduce memory and increase speed on large dataframes.
 470        :return: the Metadata object created
 471        """
 472        from .queryops import MongoQueryOps
 473        collection = self.collection(name)
 474        if is_series(obj):
 475            import pandas as pd
 476            obj = pd.DataFrame(obj, index=obj.index, columns=[str(obj.name)])
 477            store_series = True
 478        else:
 479            store_series = False
 480        if append is False:
 481            self.drop(name, force=True)
 482        elif append is None and collection.count_documents({}, limit=1):
 483            from warnings import warn
 484            warn('%s already exists, will append rows' % name)
 485        if index:
 486            # get index keys
 487            if isinstance(index, dict):
 488                idx_kwargs = index
 489                index = index.pop('columns')
 490            else:
 491                idx_kwargs = {}
 492            # create index with appropriate options
 493            keys, idx_kwargs = MongoQueryOps().make_index(index, **idx_kwargs)
 494            ensure_index(collection, keys, **idx_kwargs)
 495        if timestamp:
 496            dt = datetime.utcnow()
 497            if isinstance(timestamp, bool):
 498                col = '_created'
 499            elif isinstance(timestamp, str):
 500                col = timestamp
 501            elif isinstance(timestamp, datetime):
 502                col, dt = '_created', timestamp
 503            elif isinstance(timestamp, tuple):
 504                col, dt = timestamp
 505            else:
 506                col = '_created'
 507            obj[col] = dt
 508        # store dataframe indicies
 509        # FIXME this may be a performance issue, use size stored on stats or metadata
 510        row_count = self.collection(name).estimated_document_count()
 511        obj, idx_meta = unravel_index(obj, row_count=row_count)
 512        stored_columns = [jsonescape(col) for col in obj.columns]
 513        column_map = list(zip(obj.columns, stored_columns))
 514        d_column_map = dict(column_map)
 515        dtypes = {
 516            d_column_map.get(k): v.name
 517            for k, v in obj.dtypes.items()
 518        }
 519        kind_meta = {
 520            'columns': column_map,
 521            'dtypes': dtypes,
 522            'idx_meta': idx_meta
 523        }
 524        # ensure column names to be strings
 525        obj.columns = stored_columns
 526        # create mongon indicies for data frame index columns
 527        df_idxcols = [col for col in obj.columns if col.startswith('_idx#')]
 528        if df_idxcols:
 529            keys, idx_kwargs = MongoQueryOps().make_index(df_idxcols)
 530            ensure_index(collection, keys, **idx_kwargs)
 531        # create index on row id
 532        keys, idx_kwargs = MongoQueryOps().make_index(['_om#rowid'])
 533        ensure_index(collection, keys, **idx_kwargs)
 534        # bulk insert
 535        # -- get native objects
 536        # -- seems to be required since pymongo 3.3.x. if not converted
 537        #    pymongo raises Cannot Encode object for int64 types
 538        if ensure_compat:
 539            for col, col_dtype in dtypes.items():
 540                if 'datetime' in col_dtype:
 541                    obj[col].fillna('', inplace=True)
 542        obj = obj.astype('O', errors='ignore')
 543        _fast_insert(obj, self, name, chunksize=chunksize)
 544        kind = (MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_SEROWS
 545                if store_series
 546                else MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_DFROWS)
 547        meta = self._make_metadata(name=name,
 548                                   prefix=self.prefix,
 549                                   bucket=self.bucket,
 550                                   kind=kind,
 551                                   kind_meta=kind_meta,
 552                                   attributes=attributes,
 553                                   collection=collection.name)
 554        return meta.save()


 555


[docs]
 556    def put_dataframe_as_dfgroup(self, obj, name, groupby, attributes=None):
 557        """
 558        store a dataframe grouped by columns in a mongo document
 559
 560        :Example:
 561
 562          > # each group
 563          >  {
 564          >     #group keys
 565          >     key: val,
 566          >     _data: [
 567          >      # only data keys
 568          >        { key: val, ... }
 569          >     ]}
 570
 571        """
 572
 573        def row_to_doc(obj):
 574            for gval, gdf in obj.groupby(groupby):
 575                if hasattr(gval, 'astype'):
 576                    gval = make_tuple(gval.astype('O'))
 577                else:
 578                    gval = make_tuple(gval)
 579                doc = dict(zip(groupby, gval))
 580                datacols = list(set(gdf.columns) - set(groupby))
 581                doc['_data'] = gdf[datacols].astype('O').to_dict('records')
 582                yield doc
 583
 584        datastore = self.collection(name)
 585        datastore.drop()
 586        datastore.insert_many(row_to_doc(obj))
 587        return self._make_metadata(name=name,
 588                                   prefix=self.prefix,
 589                                   bucket=self.bucket,
 590                                   kind=MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_DFGROUP,
 591                                   attributes=attributes,
 592                                   collection=datastore.name).save()


 593
 594    def put_dataframe_as_hdf(self, obj, name, attributes=None, **kwargs):
 595        filename = self.object_store_key(name, '.hdf')
 596        hdffname = self._package_dataframe2hdf(obj, filename)
 597        with open(hdffname, 'rb') as fhdf:
 598            fileid = self.fs.put(fhdf, filename=filename)
 599        return self._make_metadata(name=name,
 600                                   prefix=self.prefix,
 601                                   bucket=self.bucket,
 602                                   kind=MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_HDF,
 603                                   attributes=attributes,
 604                                   gridfile=GridFSProxy(db_alias=self._dbalias,
 605                                                        grid_id=fileid)).save()
 606


[docs]
 607    def put_ndarray_as_hdf(self, obj, name, attributes=None, **kwargs):
 608        """ store numpy array as hdf
 609
 610        this is hack, converting the array to a dataframe then storing
 611        it
 612        """
 613        import pandas as pd
 614        df = pd.DataFrame(obj)
 615        return self.put_dataframe_as_hdf(df, name, attributes=attributes)

[docs]
 617    def put_pyobj_as_hdf(self, obj, name, attributes=None, **kwargs):
 618        """
 619        store list, tuple, dict as hdf
 620
 621        this requires the list, tuple or dict to be convertible into
 622        a dataframe
 623        """
 624        import pandas as pd
 625        df = pd.DataFrame(obj)
 626        return self.put_dataframe_as_hdf(df, name, attributes=attributes)


 627


[docs]
 628    def put_pyobj_as_document(self, obj, name, attributes=None, append=True, index=None, as_many=None, **kwargs):
 629        """
 630        store a dict as a document
 631
 632        similar to put_dataframe_as_documents no data will be replaced by
 633        default. that is, obj is appended as new documents into the objects'
 634        mongo collection. to replace the data, specify append=False.
 635        """
 636        collection = self.collection(name)
 637        if append is False:
 638            collection.drop()
 639        elif append is None and collection.esimated_document_count(limit=1):
 640            from warnings import warn
 641            warn('%s already exists, will append rows' % name)
 642        if index:
 643            # create index with appropriate options
 644            from omegaml.store import MongoQueryOps
 645            if isinstance(index, dict):
 646                idx_kwargs = index
 647                index = index.pop('columns')
 648            else:
 649                idx_kwargs = {}
 650            index = [f'data.{c}' for c in index]
 651            keys, idx_kwargs = MongoQueryOps().make_index(index, **idx_kwargs)
 652            ensure_index(collection, keys, **idx_kwargs)
 653        if as_many is None:
 654            as_many = isinstance(obj, (list, tuple)) and isinstance(obj[0], (list, tuple))
 655        if as_many:
 656            # list of lists are inserted as many objects, as in pymongo < 4
 657            records = (mongo_compatible({'data': item}) for item in obj)
 658            result = collection.insert_many(records)
 659            objid = result.inserted_ids[-1]
 660        else:
 661            result = collection.insert_one(mongo_compatible({'data': obj}))
 662            objid = result.inserted_id
 663
 664        return self._make_metadata(name=name,
 665                                   prefix=self.prefix,
 666                                   bucket=self.bucket,
 667                                   kind=MDREGISTRY.PYTHON_DATA,
 668                                   collection=collection.name,
 669                                   attributes=attributes,
 670                                   objid=objid).save()


 671


[docs]
 672    def drop(self, name, force=False, version=-1, report=False, **kwargs):
 673        """
 674        Drop the object
 675
 676        :param name: The name of the object. If the name is a pattern it will
 677           be expanded using .list(), and call .drop() on every obj found.
 678        :param force: If True ignores DoesNotExist exception, defaults to False
 679            meaning this raises a DoesNotExist exception if the name does not
 680            exist
 681        :param report: if True returns a dict name=>status, where status is True
 682            if deleted, False if not deleted
 683        :return:    True if object was deleted, False if not.
 684                    If force is True and the object does not exist it will still return True
 685        :raises: DoesNotExist if the object does not exist and ```force=False```
 686        """
 687        is_pattern = '*' in name
 688        objs = [name] if not is_pattern else self.list(name)
 689        results = []
 690        for name in objs:
 691            try:
 692                backend = self.get_backend(name)
 693                if backend is not None:
 694                    result = backend.drop(name, force=force, version=version, **kwargs)
 695                else:
 696                    result = self._drop(name, force=force, version=version)
 697            except Exception as e:
 698                results.append((name, False))
 699                if not is_pattern:
 700                    raise
 701            else:
 702                results.append((name, result))
 703        if not objs:
 704            result = self._drop(name, force=force, version=version)
 705            results.append((name, result))
 706        return dict(results) if report else len(results) > 0


 707
 708    def _drop(self, name, force=False, version=-1, keep_data=False, **kwargs):
 709        meta = self.metadata(name, version=version)
 710        if meta is None and not force:
 711            raise DoesNotExist(name)
 712        collection = self.collection(name)
 713        if collection and not keep_data:
 714            self.mongodb.drop_collection(collection.name)
 715        if meta:
 716            if meta.collection and not keep_data:
 717                self.mongodb.drop_collection(meta.collection)
 718            if meta and meta.gridfile is not None and not keep_data:
 719                meta.gridfile.delete()
 720            self._drop_metadata(name)
 721            return True
 722        return False
 723


[docs]
 724    def get_backend_bykind(self, kind, model_store=None, data_store=None,
 725                           **kwargs):
 726        """
 727        return the backend by a given object kind
 728
 729        :param kind: The object kind
 730        :param model_store: the OmegaStore instance used to store models
 731        :param data_store: the OmegaStore instance used to store data
 732        :param kwargs: the kwargs passed to the backend initialization
 733        :return: the backend
 734        """
 735        try:
 736            backend_cls = load_class(self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS[kind])
 737        except KeyError as e:
 738            raise ValueError('backend {kind} does not exist'.format(**locals()))
 739        model_store = model_store or self
 740        data_store = data_store or self
 741        backend = backend_cls(model_store=model_store,
 742                              data_store=data_store, **kwargs)
 743        return backend


 744


[docs]
 745    def get_backend(self, name, model_store=None, data_store=None, **kwargs):
 746        """
 747        return the backend by a given object name
 748
 749        :param kind: The object kind
 750        :param model_store: the OmegaStore instance used to store models
 751        :param data_store: the OmegaStore instance used to store data
 752        :param kwargs: the kwargs passed to the backend initialization
 753        :return: the backend
 754        """
 755        meta = self.metadata(name)
 756        if meta is not None and meta.kind in self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS:
 757            return self.get_backend_bykind(meta.kind,
 758                                           model_store=model_store,
 759                                           data_store=data_store,
 760                                           **kwargs)
 761        return None


 762


[docs]
 763    def help(self, name_or_obj=None, kind=None, raw=False, display=None, renderer=None):
 764        """ get help for an object by looking up its backend and calling help() on it
 765
 766        Retrieves the object's metadata and looks up its corresponding backend. If the
 767        metadata.attributes['docs'] is a string it will display this as the help() contents.
 768        If the string starts with 'http://' or 'https://' it will open the web page.
 769
 770        Args:
 771            name_or_obj (str|obj): the name or actual object to get help for
 772            kind (str): optional, if specified forces retrieval of backend for the given kind
 773            raw (bool): optional, if True forces help to be the backend type of the object.
 774                If False returns the attributes[docs] on the object's metadata, if available.
 775                Defaults to False
 776            display (fn): optional, callable for interactive display, defaults to help in
 777                if sys.flags.interactive is True, else uses pydoc.render_doc with plaintext
 778            renderer (fn): optional, the renderer= argument for pydoc.render_doc to use if
 779                sys.flags.interactive is False and display is not provided
 780
 781        Returns:
 782            * help(obj) if python is in interactive mode
 783            * text(str) if python is in not interactive mode
 784        """
 785        import sys
 786        import pydoc
 787        interactive = bool(display) if display is not None else sys.flags.interactive
 788        display = display or help
 789        renderer = renderer or pydoc.plaintext
 790        obj = self._resolve_help_backend(name_or_obj=name_or_obj, kind=kind, raw=raw)
 791        if any(str(obj.__doc__).startswith(v) for v in ('https://', 'http://')):
 792            obj = obj.__doc__
 793            if interactive and display is help:
 794                import webbrowser
 795                display = webbrowser.open
 796        return display(obj) if interactive else pydoc.render_doc(obj, renderer=renderer)


 797
 798    def _resolve_help_backend(self, name_or_obj=None, kind=None, raw=False):
 799        # helper so we can test help
 800        meta = self.metadata(name_or_obj) if name_or_obj else None
 801        if kind:
 802            backend = self.get_backend_bykind(kind)
 803        else:
 804            backend = self.get_backend(name_or_obj) or self.get_backend_byobj(name_or_obj)
 805        if backend is None:
 806            backend = self
 807        if not raw and meta is not None and 'docs' in meta.attributes:
 808            def UserDocumentation():
 809                pass
 810
 811            basedoc = backend.__doc__ or ''
 812            UserDocumentation.__doc__ = (basedoc +
 813                                         meta.attributes['docs'])
 814            backend = UserDocumentation
 815        return backend
 816


[docs]
 817    def get_backend_byobj(self, obj, name=None, kind=None, attributes=None,
 818                          model_store=None, data_store=None, **kwargs):
 819        """
 820        return the matching backend for the given obj
 821
 822        Returns:
 823            the first backend that supports the given parameters or None
 824        """
 825        model_store = model_store or self
 826        data_store = data_store or self
 827        meta = self.metadata(name) if name else None
 828        kind = kind or (meta.kind if meta is not None else None)
 829        backend = None
 830        if kind:
 831            objtype = str(type(obj))
 832            if kind in self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS:
 833                backend = self.get_backend_bykind(kind, data_store=data_store, model_store=model_store)
 834                if not backend.supports(obj, name, attributes=attributes,
 835                                        data_store=data_store,
 836                                        model_store=model_store,
 837                                        kind=kind, **kwargs):
 838                    warnings.warn('Backend {kind} does not support {objtype}'.format(**locals()))
 839            else:
 840                pass
 841                # TODO refactor pandas and numpy handling into proper backend to avoid misleading warning
 842                # warnings.warn('Backend {kind} not found {objtype}. Reverting to default'.format(**locals()))
 843        else:
 844            for backend_kind, backend_cls in self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_BACKENDS.items():
 845                backend = self.get_backend_bykind(backend_kind, data_store=data_store, model_store=model_store)
 846                if backend.supports(obj, name, attributes=attributes,
 847                                    data_store=data_store, model_store=model_store,
 848                                    **kwargs):
 849                    break
 850            else:
 851                backend = None
 852        return backend

 854    def getl(self, *args, **kwargs):
 855        """ return a lazy MDataFrame for a given object
 856
 857        Same as .get, but returns a MDataFrame
 858
 859        """
 860        return self.get(*args, lazy=True, **kwargs)


 861


[docs]
 862    def get(self, name, version=-1, force_python=False,
 863            kind=None, model_store=None, data_store=None, **kwargs):
 864        """
 865        Retrieve an object
 866
 867        :param name: The name of the object
 868        :param version: Version of the stored object (not supported)
 869        :param force_python: Return as a python object
 870        :param kwargs: kwargs depending on object kind
 871        :return: an object, estimator, pipelines, data array or pandas dataframe
 872            previously stored with put()
 873        """
 874        meta = self.metadata(name, version=version)
 875        if meta is None:
 876            return None
 877        if not force_python:
 878            backend = (self.get_backend(name, model_store=model_store,
 879                                        data_store=data_store)
 880                       if not kind else self.get_backend_bykind(kind,
 881                                                                model_store=model_store,
 882                                                                data_store=data_store))
 883            if backend is not None:
 884                # FIXME: some backends need to get model_store, data_store, but fails tests
 885                return backend.get(name, **kwargs)  # model_store=model_store, data_store=data_store, **kwargs)
 886            if meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.SKLEARN_JOBLIB:
 887                backend = self.get_backend(name)
 888                return backend.get_model(name)
 889            elif meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.SPARK_MLLIB:
 890                backend = self.get_backend(name)
 891                return backend.get_model(name, version)
 892            elif meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_DFROWS:
 893                return self.get_dataframe_documents(name, version=version,
 894                                                    **kwargs)
 895            elif meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_SEROWS:
 896                return self.get_dataframe_documents(name, version=version,
 897                                                    is_series=True,
 898                                                    **kwargs)
 899            elif meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_DFGROUP:
 900                return self.get_dataframe_dfgroup(
 901                    name, version=version, **kwargs)
 902            elif meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PYTHON_DATA:
 903                return self.get_python_data(name, version=version, **kwargs)
 904            elif meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_HDF:
 905                return self.get_dataframe_hdf(name, version=version)
 906        return self.get_object_as_python(meta, version=version)


 907


[docs]
 908    def get_dataframe_documents(self, name, columns=None, lazy=False,
 909                                filter=None, version=-1, is_series=False,
 910                                chunksize=None, sanitize=True, trusted=None,
 911                                **kwargs):
 912        """
 913        Internal method to return DataFrame from documents
 914
 915        :param name: the name of the object (str)
 916        :param columns: the column projection as a list of column names
 917        :param lazy: if True returns a lazy representation as an MDataFrame.
 918           If False retrieves all data and returns a DataFrame (default)
 919        :param filter: the filter to be applied as a column__op=value dict
 920        :param sanitize: sanitize filter by removing all $op filter keys,
 921          defaults to True. Specify False to allow $op filter keys. $where
 922          is always removed as it is considered unsafe.
 923        :param version: the version to retrieve (not supported)
 924        :param is_series: if True retruns a Series instead of a DataFrame
 925        :param kwargs: remaining kwargs are used a filter. The filter kwarg
 926           overrides other kwargs.
 927        :return: the retrieved object (DataFrame, Series or MDataFrame)
 928
 929        """
 930        from omegaml.store.queryops import sanitize_filter
 931        from omegaml.store.filtered import FilteredCollection
 932
 933        collection = self.collection(name)
 934        meta = self.metadata(name)
 935        filter = filter or kwargs
 936        filter = sanitize_filter(filter, no_ops=sanitize, trusted=trusted)
 937        if lazy or chunksize:
 938            from ..mdataframe import MDataFrame
 939            df = MDataFrame(collection,
 940                            metadata=meta.kind_meta,
 941                            columns=columns).query(**filter)
 942            if is_series:
 943                df = df[0]
 944            if chunksize is not None and chunksize > 0:
 945                return df.iterchunks(chunksize=chunksize)
 946        else:
 947            # TODO ensure the same processing is applied in MDataFrame
 948            # TODO this method should always use a MDataFrame disregarding lazy
 949            if filter:
 950                from .query import Filter
 951                query = Filter(collection, **filter).query
 952                cursor = FilteredCollection(collection).find(filter=query, projection=columns)
 953            else:
 954                cursor = FilteredCollection(collection).find(projection=columns)
 955            # restore dataframe
 956            df = cursor_to_dataframe(cursor)
 957            if '_id' in df.columns:
 958                del df['_id']
 959            if hasattr(meta, 'kind_meta'):
 960                df = convert_dtypes(df, meta.kind_meta.get('dtypes', {}))
 961            # -- restore columns
 962            meta_columns = dict(meta.kind_meta.get('columns'))
 963            if meta_columns:
 964                # apply projection, if any
 965                if columns:
 966                    # get only projected columns
 967                    # meta_columns is {origin_column: stored_column}
 968                    orig_columns = dict({k: v for k, v in meta_columns.items()
 969                                         if k in columns or v in columns})
 970                else:
 971                    # restore columns to original name
 972                    orig_columns = meta_columns
 973                df.rename(columns=orig_columns, inplace=True)
 974            # -- restore indexes
 975            idx_meta = meta.kind_meta.get('idx_meta')
 976            if idx_meta:
 977                df = restore_index(df, idx_meta)
 978            # -- restore row order
 979            if is_series:
 980                index = df.index
 981                name = df.columns[0]
 982                df = df[name]
 983                df.index = index
 984                df.name = None if name == 'None' else name
 985        return df


 986


[docs]
 987    def rebuild_params(self, kwargs, collection):
 988        """
 989        Returns a modified set of parameters for querying mongodb
 990        based on how the mongo document is structured and the
 991        fields the document is grouped by.
 992
 993        **Note: Explicitly to be used with get_grouped_data only**
 994
 995        :param kwargs: Mongo filter arguments
 996        :param collection: The name of mongodb collection
 997        :return: Returns a set of parameters as dictionary.
 998        """
 999        modified_params = {}
1000        db_structure = collection.find_one({}, {'_id': False})
1001        groupby_columns = list(set(db_structure.keys()) - set(['_data']))
1002        if kwargs is not None:
1003            for item in kwargs:
1004                if item not in groupby_columns:
1005                    modified_query_param = '_data.' + item
1006                    modified_params[modified_query_param] = kwargs.get(item)
1007                else:
1008                    modified_params[item] = kwargs.get(item)
1009        return modified_params


1010


[docs]
1011    def get_dataframe_dfgroup(self, name, version=-1, sanitize=True, kwargs=None):
1012        """
1013        Return a grouped dataframe
1014
1015        :param name: the name of the object
1016        :param version: not supported
1017        :param kwargs: mongo db query arguments to be passed to
1018               collection.find() as a filter.
1019        :param sanitize: remove any $op operators in kwargs
1020
1021        """
1022        import pandas as pd
1023        from omegaml.store.queryops import sanitize_filter
1024        from omegaml.store.filtered import FilteredCollection
1025
1026        def convert_doc_to_row(cursor):
1027            for doc in cursor:
1028                data = doc.pop('_data', [])
1029                for row in data:
1030                    doc.update(row)
1031                    yield doc
1032
1033        datastore = FilteredCollection(self.collection(name))
1034        kwargs = kwargs if kwargs else {}
1035        params = self.rebuild_params(kwargs, datastore)
1036        params = sanitize_filter(params, no_ops=sanitize)
1037        cursor = datastore.find(params, projection={'_id': False})
1038        df = pd.DataFrame(convert_doc_to_row(cursor))
1039        return df

[docs]
1041    def get_dataframe_hdf(self, name, version=-1):
1042        """
1043        Retrieve dataframe from hdf
1044
1045        :param name: The name of object
1046        :param version: The version of object (not supported)
1047        :return: Returns a python pandas dataframe
1048        :raises: gridfs.errors.NoFile
1049        """
1050        df = None
1051        meta = self.metadata(name)
1052        filename = getattr(meta.gridfile, 'name', self.object_store_key(name, '.hdf'))
1053        if self.fs.exists(filename=filename):
1054            df = self._extract_dataframe_hdf(filename, version=version)
1055            return df
1056        else:
1057            raise gridfs.errors.NoFile(
1058                "{0} does not exist in mongo collection '{1}'".format(
1059                    name, self.bucket))


1060


[docs]
1061    def get_python_data(self, name, filter=None, version=-1, lazy=False, trusted=False, **kwargs):
1062        """
1063        Retrieve objects as python data
1064
1065        :param name: The name of object
1066        :param version: The version of object
1067
1068        :return: Returns the object as python list object
1069        """
1070        datastore = self.collection(name)
1071        filter = filter or kwargs
1072        sanitize_filter(filter) if trusted is False or trusted != signature(filter) else filter
1073        cursor = datastore.find(filter, **kwargs)
1074        if lazy:
1075            return cursor
1076        data = (d.get('data') for d in cursor)
1077        return list(data)


1078


[docs]
1079    def get_object_as_python(self, meta, version=-1):
1080        """
1081        Retrieve object as python object
1082
1083        :param meta: The metadata object
1084        :param version: The version of the object
1085
1086        :return: Returns data as python object
1087        """
1088        if meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.SKLEARN_JOBLIB:
1089            return meta.gridfile
1090        if meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_HDF:
1091            return meta.gridfile
1092        if meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PANDAS_DFROWS:
1093            return list(getattr(self.mongodb, meta.collection).find())
1094        if meta.kind == MDREGISTRY.PYTHON_DATA:
1095            col = getattr(self.mongodb, meta.collection)
1096            return col.find_one(dict(_id=meta.objid)).get('data')
1097        raise TypeError('cannot return kind %s as a python object' % meta.kind)


1098
1099    def __iter__(self):
1100        for f in self.list(include_temp=True):
1101            yield f
1102
1103    @property
1104    def buckets(self):
1105        return ['default' if b == self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_COLLECTION else b
1106                for b in self._Metadata.objects.distinct('bucket')]
1107


[docs]
1108    def list(self, pattern=None, regexp=None, kind=None, raw=False, hidden=None,
1109             include_temp=False, bucket=None, prefix=None, filter=None):
1110        """
1111        List all files in store
1112
1113        specify pattern as a unix pattern (e.g. :code:`models/*`,
1114        or specify regexp)
1115
1116        :param pattern: the unix file pattern or None for all
1117        :param regexp: the regexp. takes precedence over pattern
1118        :param raw: if True return the meta data objects
1119        :param filter: specify additional filter criteria, optional
1120        :return: List of files in store
1121
1122        """
1123        regex = lambda pattern: bson.regex.Regex(f'{pattern}')
1124        db = self.mongodb
1125        searchkeys = dict(bucket=bucket or self.bucket,
1126                          prefix=prefix or self.prefix)
1127        q_excludes = Q()
1128        if regexp:
1129            searchkeys['name'] = regex(regexp)
1130        elif pattern:
1131            re_pattern = pattern.replace('*', '.*').replace('/', r'\/')
1132            searchkeys['name'] = regex(f'^{re_pattern}$')
1133        if not include_temp:
1134            q_excludes &= Q(name__not__startswith='_')
1135            q_excludes &= Q(name__not=regex(r'(.{1,*}\/?_.*)'))
1136        if not hidden:
1137            q_excludes &= Q(name__not__startswith='.')
1138        if kind or self.force_kind:
1139            kind = kind or self.force_kind
1140            if isinstance(kind, (tuple, list)):
1141                searchkeys.update(kind__in=kind)
1142            else:
1143                searchkeys.update(kind=kind)
1144        if filter:
1145            searchkeys.update(filter)
1146        q_search = Q(**searchkeys) & q_excludes
1147        files = self._Metadata.objects.no_cache()(q_search)
1148        return [f if raw else str(f.name).replace('.omm', '') for f in files]


1149


[docs]
1150    def exists(self, name, hidden=False):
1151        """ check if object exists
1152
1153        Args:
1154            name (str): name of object
1155            hidden (bool): if True, include hidden files, defaults to
1156              False, unless name starts with '.'
1157
1158        Returns:
1159            bool, True if object exists
1160
1161        .. versionchanged:: 0.16.4
1162            hidden defaults to True if name starts with '.'
1163        """
1164        hidden = True if name.startswith('.') else hidden
1165        return name in self.list(name, hidden=hidden)


1166


[docs]
1167    def object_store_key(self, name, ext, hashed=None):
1168        """
1169        Returns the store key
1170
1171        Unless you write a mixin or a backend you should not use this method
1172
1173        :param name: The name of object
1174        :param ext: The extension of the filename
1175        :param hashed: hash the key to support arbitrary name length, defaults
1176           to defaults.OMEGA_STORE_HASHEDNAMES, True by default since 0.13.7
1177
1178        :return: A filename with relative bucket, prefix and name
1179        """
1180        # byte string
1181        _u8 = lambda t: t.encode('UTF-8', 'replace') if isinstance(t, str) else t
1182        key = self._get_obj_store_key(name, ext)
1183        hashed = hashed if hashed is not None else self.defaults.OMEGA_STORE_HASHEDNAMES
1184        if hashed:
1185            from hashlib import sha1
1186            # SEC: CWE-916
1187            # - status: wontfix
1188            # - reason: hashcode is used purely for name resolution, not a security function
1189            hasher = sha1()
1190            hasher.update(_u8(key))
1191            key = hasher.hexdigest()
1192        return key


1193
1194    def _get_obj_store_key(self, name, ext, prefix=None, bucket=None):
1195        # backwards compatilibity implementation of object_store_key()
1196        name = '%s.%s' % (name, ext) if not name.endswith(ext) else name
1197        filename = '{bucket}.{prefix}.{name}'.format(
1198            bucket=bucket or self.bucket,
1199            prefix=prefix or self.prefix,
1200            name=name,
1201            ext=ext).replace('/', '_').replace('..', '.')
1202        return filename
1203
1204    def _package_dataframe2hdf(self, df, filename, key=None):
1205        """
1206        Package a dataframe as a hdf file
1207
1208        :param df: The dataframe
1209        :param filename: Name of file
1210
1211        :return: Filename of hdf file
1212        """
1213        lpath = tempfile.mkdtemp()
1214        fname = os.path.basename(filename)
1215        hdffname = os.path.join(self.tmppath, fname + '.hdf')
1216        key = key or 'data'
1217        df.to_hdf(hdffname, key)
1218        return hdffname
1219
1220    def _extract_dataframe_hdf(self, filename, version=-1):
1221        """
1222        Extracts a dataframe from a stored hdf file
1223
1224        :param filename: The name of file
1225        :param version: The version of file
1226
1227        :return: Pandas dataframe
1228        """
1229        import pandas as pd
1230        hdffname = os.path.join(self.tmppath, filename)
1231        dirname = os.path.dirname(hdffname)
1232        if not os.path.exists(dirname):
1233            os.makedirs(dirname)
1234        try:
1235            outf = self.fs.get_version(filename, version=version)
1236        except gridfs.errors.NoFile as e:
1237            raise e
1238        with open(hdffname, 'wb') as hdff:
1239            hdff.write(outf.read())
1240        hdf = pd.HDFStore(hdffname)
1241        key = list(hdf.keys())[0]
1242        df = hdf[key]
1243        hdf.close()
1244        return df
1245
1246    def _ensure_fs_collection(self):
1247        # ensure backwards-compatible gridfs access
1248        if self.defaults.OMEGA_BUCKET_FS_LEGACY:
1249            # prior to 0.13.2 a single gridfs instance was used, always equal to the default collection
1250            return self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_COLLECTION
1251        if self.bucket == self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_COLLECTION:
1252            # from 0.13.2 onwards, only the default bucket is equal to the default collection
1253            # backwards compatibility for existing installations
1254            return self.bucket
1255        # since 0.13.2, all buckets other than the default use a qualified collection name to
1256        # effectively separate files in different buckets, enabling finer-grade access control
1257        # and avoiding name collisions from different buckets
1258        return '{}_{}'.format(self.defaults.OMEGA_MONGO_COLLECTION, self.bucket)
1259
1260    def _ensure_fs_index(self, fs):
1261        # make sure we have proper chunks and file indicies. this should be created on first write, but sometimes is not
1262        # see https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/core/gridfs/#gridfs-indexes
1263        # pymongo since 4.1 no longer has fs._GridFS
1264        chunks_collection = fs._GridFS__chunks if hasattr(fs, '_GridFS__chunks') else fs._chunks
1265        files_collection = fs._GridFS__files if hasattr(fs, '_GridFS__files') else fs._files
1266        ensure_index(chunks_collection, {'files_id': 1, 'n': 1}, unique=True)
1267        ensure_index(files_collection, {'filename': 1, 'uploadDate': 1})
1268
1269    def sign(self, filter):
1270        return signature(filter)
1271
1272    @staticmethod
1273    def _cleanup(objrepr, tmppath=None):
1274        # cleanup any temporary files on exit
1275        # -- this is called as a finalizer (weakref.finalize)
1276        try:
1277            logger.debug(f'finalizing {objrepr}: cleaning up temporary files in {tmppath}')
1278            shutil.rmtree(tmppath, ignore_errors=True)
1279        except Exception as e:
1280            logger.error(f'finalizing {objrepr}: error occured as {e}')
